page.title: 04TICKNALL LIMEYARDS
page.content: "The Limeyards" cover approximately 50 acres of land to the South East of Ticknall, part of the Harpur-Crewe Estate. These abandoned works were used between 1874 & 1915 for quarrying & burning Lime for sale in Ashby de la Zouch. It was transported there by a 4'2" gauge horse-drawn tramway, which was officially closed in 1915. This has left a fascinating study area for botanists, naturalists & ornithologists & anyone who enjoys natural beauty. The four quarries are waterfilled & used for fishing for perch,tench & an elusive carp! The areas between are filled with deciduous woodland & all manner of lime loving plants. The Derbyshire Naturalist Trust manages a part which houses the rarest plants i.e. the bee orchid, to protect & preserve them.
